<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
0580/11  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 210, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 325, 904, 340]]<|/det|>
1 hour  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 383, 400, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 280, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 480, 543]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 333, 559]]<|/det|>
You may use tracing paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 467, 575]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 855, 606]]<|/det|>
Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 490, 621]]<|/det|>
For \(\pi\) , use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 219, 666]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 667, 384, 682]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 56.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 728, 698]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 390, 92]]<|/det|>
The volume of a cuboid is \(24 \mathrm{~cm}^3\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 89, 425, 108]]<|/det|>
The base of the cuboid is \(3 \mathrm{~cm}\) by \(2 \mathrm{~cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 457, 140]]<|/det|>
Draw a net of the cuboid on the \(1\mathrm{~cm}^2\) grid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 794, 920, 813]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 106, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>14</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 354, 94]]<|/det|>
Change \(680 000 \mathrm{~cm}^3\) into \(\mathrm{m}^3\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 166, 928, 186]]<|/det|>
<form>...................................... \(\mathrm{m}^3\)  [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 214, 104, 234]]<|/det|>
<label>15</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 214, 759, 234]]<|/det|>
The length, \(l\) metres, of a piece of rope is \(5.67 \text{m}\), correct to the nearest centimetre.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 246, 470, 265]]<|/det|>
Complete this statement about the value of \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 320, 920, 342]]<|/det|>
<form>.................... $\leqslant l <$ ....................  [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 370, 104, 388]]<|/det|>
<label>16</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 368, 489, 388]]<|/det|>
Without using a calculator, work out \(1 \frac{3}{8} - \frac{5}{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 392, 806, 413]]<|/det|>
You must show all your working and give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 688, 920, 707]]<|/det|>
<form>......................................  [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>22</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 662, 91]]<|/det|>
There is a straight road between town \(A\) and town \(B\) of length \(130\mathrm{km}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 405, 121]]<|/det|>
Maxi travels from town \(A\) to town \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 405, 137]]<|/det|>
Pippa travels from town \(B\) to town \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 450, 153]]<|/det|>
Both travel at a constant speed of \(40\mathrm{km / h}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 150, 413, 168]]<|/det|>
Maxi leaves 30 minutes before Pippa.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 180, 670, 198]]<|/det|>
Work out how far from town \(A\) they will be when they pass each other.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 473, 920, 492]]<|/det|>
<form>...................................... $km$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 473, 920, 492]]<|/det|>
